comments.text: Some taxi drivers under the bridge so I walked just a bit further towards Shymkent and got a ride in no time.
I like this place under the bidge and locasl too. There is a shadow there.
I just came to the check point and ask the track driver to pick up us to Semey in 2013. Nice.
that was a first time after 5 years of h-hiking expirience when I just started thumbing and after 5 second stopped 2 friendly cars in proper direction :)
use marshrutka 10 from citycenter or roundabout in southern part of city(see page in Hitchwiki) to Benzokolonka busstop(Gasstation)
We got a lift for free. We were three people :)

Walked along road thumbing, first car stopped. It looked like a marshutka, so I said skolka (how much) and they happily said its free! Spoke bssic English and had a micro conversation
 Took me to semy/kaindy. Total legends.
Good spot to hitch after crossing the border from Usbekistan. We walked 35 minutes from the border to the spot. A car took my friend, my bicycle and me :)
Hitched nice overnight car directly to Semey in autumn 2014.

While hitching north there is high probability that you will hitchhike after Ucharal's police checkpoint as almost 90% of cars turn to Ucharal. I guess wait here is more comfortable than closer to that checkpoint. First, here is a river and you can fresh yourself anytime. Second, you can stay at night near the river. it's better that sleep on sand. Third, road on the bridge is in vary bad condition so cars cross bridge at 30-40km/h. Forth, police in Kazakhstan may ask you some stupid questions a

Just checked out the mausoleum and now you want to head towards Shymkent-Almaty? Just walk for about 5-10 minutes from the mausoleum and you can start HHing. Explain the driver that you are hitchhiking or travelling without money/paying.

Near the entrance of the sea port, there is a tiny cafe run by a woman named "Asia". It's the waiting place for all truck drivers coming from Azerbaijan by ferry and most of them are Turkish and Georgian, so speaking Turkish or Russian helps a lot. Ask these gentlemen nicely and you may find a direct ride all the way to Almaty. It will take you around 4 days however.
I came here from previous bad position by foot so can't explain public transportation. I stood less than 5 seconds.
nice place to get direct lift to Taraz
from bus station take bus 12, 35 or 202.

take a bus to Tuberculosis dispensary (Туберкулезный диспансер) then walk a bit from busstop Post GAI to the bridge above the road. U can h-hike on the road and ask drivers directly on the gasstation or road cafe.
4 Persons split up in 2 groups in dir Altay....worked quite fast

from metro \"rechnoy vokzal\" use minibus #221 or 222 to busstop \"vokzal\" in Berdsk, then walk couple km till crossroads with roadlights. also there is speed limit 40 kmph. position is right after crossroads

siberian_explorer

excellent way to ask policemans to get a lift for you throughout Taraz or to Chimkent :) works great in both directions

siberian_explorer
No problems getting in and out of the canyon with hitchhiking.
Got a quick ride to the next village. Probably possible to find one to Almaty from here but that wasn't my destination.
Great spot, lot of cars were stopping. We got ride to Beyneu, we paid around 10€ but you can definitely get a free ride as well, but in longer time.
Got a ride to Tukistan after 10 minutes (July 2025 - solo male). Traffic is decent, easy for cars to stop, good visibility from afar. You can stay under the bridge for some shade.
Very nice people and spot
very good road to hichhick in almost all its lenght, we got like 5 cars to reach Altai, all them very fast.
There aren't many options to wait in this area. A truck drive took as the whole night.
We and the driver wanted to go to the same kaindy lake. They took us to the parking space where they changed to a taxi. They invited us for the taxiride to the lake.
We were theee people. Some drivers wanted money. "Kapusta pusta" (cabbage is empty) helped and we got a lift for free.

We were two people and one bicycle hitching to Almaty. As soon as we were waiting at the street there where cars and truck stopping. A friendly truckdriver took us with all our bags and bicycle. He was super friendly!

Just by the seti entrance arch. With thumb, in rain, getting dark. After a few rejections a driver stopped. It 
I was in a hurry so happy to pay, and I had been told the rate was 5000 (10 Euro) so offered him that. He accepted but said it was small. At the end of the ride  a kazakh hitchhiker paid him 2000 ( they gave him 5000 and he gave 3000 Change. Either him saying my payment was small was sarcasm, or it's the usual ripoff for tourists. Still dngaf. Zero English and it was rainy af.
Walking along road thumbing, 3rd car stopped. No English so used broken Russian. Payment not mentioned or requested. Drivers were fun and took me to seti.  Yay!

Walking along, thumbed and first car stopped. not too many cars so they stopped in the road. Zero english but eager to help the foreign moron. Took me 2km to the exit for kaindy lake and semy. Really kind people. I did not mention payment and they didn't seem to expect it.

Outside the gas station. Thumb out directly on road using sign as well. Good spot for east towards kegen, kaindy lake and Kyrgyzstan. A bit messy with slip roads etc by the side of a fast 2 lane road, but it worked as people pulled over in the slip road. Drivers where a shared taxi, spoke zero English but basic Russian worked. They wanted 4000t (7.50 EURO) to legend. I could have rejected but as it was getting dark and in a hurry I paid. Driver was honest and fun and waited with the foreign idio
Perfect spot for Uzb border, slow speeds. You can cross the railroad tracks easily here to reach the road or the town.
Bus stop. Long rides from here. Got to Beynou after a 10 minute wait.
Bus stop somewhere here. Perfect spot for heading north. Ask to be dropped off before the town if coming from the south as rides going further will take this road around it.
Direction east. Anywhere on this road works really but after the town, all the cars go far away. Not too many cars but one will stop really fast.

The border crossing from both sides was pretty smooth and fast, despite the reviews in google maps. Maybe depends of the season. After passing the border walk a few minutes till the turn. There is enough transport, we got a direct ride to Beineu in 10 minutes.

Easy to find a lift when you arrived by airplane
Almost everyone is going to Aktau.
The road leading east was under construction (October 2024) so everyone was heading north to the big road instead.
Bus 71 from city center busstop Ozero goes straight to the roundabout.
dddd
<s>ssss
<s>ssss
Good spot to district Actobe
Wanna hitch through spectacular Karatau mountains? Nice place to start doing it is right here.
There might be more taxis than private cars passing, but it was still pretty easy to get a direct ride to Almaty.

position is right after check point, take your chanse while cars are slow. many taxists asking for money.
Almaty direction.

siberian_explorer
Hitching here is pure luck.
Do not ride to Korday on the way to Almaty. Use this place to get direct car to Almaty. Car are passing fast but some friendly drivers will stop anyway.
On ther way from north to Bishkek you got option to go to Almaty and lost 4-5 hours or turn to Chy. Waiting time is pure luck.

On the way from Pavlodar to Karaganda there is high probability that your lift will turn here to Ekibastuz. It's okay just wa
it for another one. Also you can hide from rain under the bridge.
A fine spot if you are going towards Omsk. Follow this road and avoid the city center.
Take the bus #24 to "Ondiris Road" and walk for a little bit. It's a good spot to HH northeast towards the Russian border.
As carpooling is common in Kazakhstan, don't forget to explain the driver that you are HHing and not going to pay for the ride.

ask locals how to get to AltynOrda market or use bus #303 from train station Almaty#1 (prepare to loooong ride throungh all markets of the city). at last when you will get to AltynOrda walk along road app. 500 meters till gas stations.

siberian_explorer
This is the only one place worth to h-hike to from Almaty. After car flow splits here wait for direct car to Korday
here is the exit to Karasuk
take bus 38 from train station to Leninsky village
take a bus to Southern bus station, them walk from crossroad till the city ends
Generally hitchhiking in Karaganda is bad, bad, bad. Many times I stood there for hours.

from Ogonek busstop take minibus to Shubarsu(Ð¨ÑƒÐ±Ð°Ñ€ÑÑƒ) app. 0,7USD. ask driver to stop after turning off the main road. h-hike after crossroads.

siberian_explorer

position is right after T-liked crossroads while cars are very slow. Sometimes position is crowded by locals, so walk a bit forward. Taraz, Shymkent, Karaganda direction.

siberian_explorer

from roundabout where Medical college located and road splits on Ushtobe and Almaty directions take marsrutka #13. from the last stop on the route walk forward a bit, cross small crossroads and start h-hiking

siberian_explorer
take bus #17 from Central market till "Toulpar" lake.
ask for a bus to Zhybek-Zhol car market, for example, #35 or #111 from "Ogonek" near hotel Shymkent, from bus stop walk a bit along road

ask a bus to Busstation ("avtovokzal" in russian). then walk a bit along road with 4 lanes. since empty field starts start your thumbing
waiting time less than 1 hour

siberian_explorer
Quiet but first car took me to the border. If the border guards ask if you have a knife (even a camping one) maybe say no. They took mine :'(

Quiet spot but a good one. Traffic lights to slow the cars. Most likely cars will drive to Karkara or even the border. September 2025 the road had some construction and was in bad shape but there were still people going.
High speeds and not too many cars as most turn to the lake up the mountains. But it's Kazakhstan, people will stop for you no matter what.
Pretty good spot. Some locals hitchhiking here too. Found a ride to Charyn Canyon entrance road quite fast.

Good spot despite somewhat quiet traffic. People take this southern route to Almaty, instead of the northern one also starting from this roundabout. I was going to Charyn Canyon so I hopped out midway through though.

(July 2025 - solo male) Walked while hitchhiking with a sign to Otrar. A car stopped after a few minutes giving me a ride straight to the mausoleum. Visibility is great; traffic is decent; if there is not too much traffic, cars can pull over easily. There are busses going to this place, although I don't remember the numbers. You should be able to ask around though.
Good spot with place to stop easily. A guy picked us up and drove the whole nigt to Astana.
nice road with great views. not much traffic.
while walking to the outside of the city a man randomly stopped in the road to pick us up
Good spot. there is a old bus station with shadow
Correct side to go to sibily lakes
Just stood next to the onramp and got a ride to Taraz in no time.
The bus stop, where people are catching the taxis. Got a ride with a nice family almost all the way to Shymkent.
Cars are passing fast, but still here is a good chances to get a long distance ride here. We got a short one though.
Thera are many local cars going on a small distance, drivers might ask for money, so make sure you understood each other. Got a short ride after 15min to better position on the A-2 turn few km away.

Good traffic and a lot of cars stop for us, but most of them asked for money. When we said "no money" they passed through. It took about an hour to move from this place and it was, I think, the twenty-fifth car who agreed to go without paying money.
There is a bus 207 from busstop called "Center" located on the main street not far from citymarket and railstation. It goes straight to "Kolonka" (2014)

take a bus #41 from ring between two bridges on the left riverside. on the last stop called "Myasokombinat" (landmark is a park filled by military technic stuff) cross the road and wait for the bus #13. ask for "Kolonka" busstop. bus will turns left but you should follow wide 4 lane road. pass by crowd of locals trying to get lift for money and start thumbing. many taxists here, but h-hiking still doable
waiting time around couple hours depends on luck

siberian_explorer

There are many taxis and minibuses going in this direction. Although the minibus is cheap, almost all cars go to Bishkek. You may try your chance and wait for one. Explain the driver that you are HHing, not carpooling.

here is an a checkpoin with stopline. there is two option to reach Biskek from here:
1. to h-hike
2. to take a route minibus to Bishkek(20KGSoms=0,5USD in 2010).
Police check point is located here. Speed limit 40. Light. Wait car to the Almaty.
There was severe changes in road infrastructure of Novosibirsk. Police checkpoint is closed. Transit traffic goes on Severnyi ob'ezd (Северный объезд). Forget about this spot.

from metro \"Zaeltcovskaya\" take bus #1073, 1027, 1042 to busstop \"Lesnaya\", go back to T-liked crossroads and walk 500m along road to the police checkpoint in eastern direction. Landmark is a gasstation on the right side and lots of cafe.

siberian_explorer
here is Zhansaya district bus stop located, ask a locals about transportation. beware lots of drivers asking for money even if you clearly explained that you are got no money
My girlfriend and I were spent here more than an hour and finaly got a local bus (Atyrau-Astrakhan'). No one stopped here. Most of the cars are local. Traffic is medium.

Its an alright spot to get to the highway. If you're new to central asian hitchhiking this might be a cold start and you'll have to figure out the taxi thing, but you'll get used to it. Experience for us: 
Three cars stopped and the third gave us a ride. They said we had no chance of hitchhiking and tried to find someone for us at truck stops. They then treated us to plov and drove us to the 5 km to highway :) 
(30m&25f, white)

This road is insane. it took us 2 days to reach katon karagay from here. The car got stuck in mud and we had to cut some trees and dig with shovels (which are required to enter this road) to get the car out. I highly recomd the experience.
This is the middle of nowhere. No one takes this road. After 4 hours only 2 cars passed by. If you continue to Austrian Road must be prepared for a very hard path.
It's not a begginers spot. There are just few cars every 30min cause they come from the ferry. There are no villages near by, so could end the lift in the absolute middle of nowhere.
We wanted to hitch to Almaty. It did not work really smooth. A lot of car stopped wanted money or offered a drive to Shymkent. A car took us (my friend, me and my bicycle) to the Almaty highway.
Not too many cars but people will stop for you.
Very quiet, especially in the later hours as border closes at 17 (Kazakh time). 2md car picked me up and took me to the next village.
Can't cross border now as a pedestrian!! (as of sept 2025) Need to book a bus from China to Zharkent. 8€ and took like 3-4 hours all together (waiting for the bus to fill up and crossing the border)
Towards Zharkent. After crossing the border, just walk 15 minutes until you come to the end of tow. Traffic is very low. Unlike in China. make the money issue clear before you get in the car.
I agree, get out of Bishkek by bus saves you time.

here you could take a bus to KaraBalta or Sosnovka's turn because h-hiking here almost senceless. 50 soms~1USD(2010) will save many hours of waiting

siberian_explorer

looks like this is not bad position to start hitching to north direction, but in fact it's crowded by taxists and locals, I stood 1 hour and got nothing. but it's easy to get from Altyn-Orda bazaar (western enter of city) on 303 bus to busstop Promkombinat.
after some changes in infrastructure of transport waiting here is almost senseless. better use nothern direction

bad position. lots of locals and taxy. almost no transit.
waiting time for hours

siberian_explorer

Monday 7a.m. july in 1h, about 5 cars. No one stopped
Direction to the border
Terrible terrible place! Don't let the driver drop you off here and go through the center on Kokteshau even if you have to walk. This road is deserted and there are few cars passing by.
This side of the road is in no use. A local man from the village aproached us to tell us to go the other side from the north, cause no one uses the road
